p:
MERS-CoV seroprevalence among the general human population in Saudi Arabia is less than 0·5%, although it is substantially higher in camel shepherds (2·3%) and slaughterhouse workers (3·6%).
4 MERS-CoV is highly prevalent in dromedary camels on the Arabian Peninsula and dromedary camels are the likely source of primary human MERS-CoV infections.
5
